title: Disabled context isolation is a security hole/please enable
body:
**Describe the bug**
For #434 and further #492 context isolation was disabled. This is a security issue as it exposes
all electron api to websites running inside Electron.

If I understand correctly one has to implement contextBridges to be able to use ipcRender which
is required for WebRTC.
I've linked a few documentation pages around this below.

**Desktop :**
 - OS: any
 - Installation package: any
 - Version: >1.0.0.17

**Additional context**
- Related issue: #492
- Commit in question: https://github.com/IsmaelMartinez/teams-for-linux/commit/6e8782b41016e628b69c73de8a4422d175105701
- [Electron on Context Isolation](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/tutorial/context-isolation)
- [Electron on contextBridge](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/latest/api/context-bridge)
- [WebRTC-hid-SDK on Context Isolation](https://github.com/RibbonCommunications/webrtc-hid-sdk/blob/HEAD/docs/context-isolation.md)
